DETAILED_HELP: Use "help [command]" to get detailed help about given command
Echoes given message as new line

HELP: Gives you info about us and our members/authors
DETAILED_HELP:
Gives you info about us and our members/authors
	Authors:
		Lyagva
Prints content of current directory\n\tUse "cd" to move between them
Moves between directories\n\tUse "ls" to get list of all directories

HELP: Outputs content of a given file
DETAILED_HELP: Outputs content of a given file

Operates with audio sub-system

	-l -load <filename>	loads given audio file
	-v -vol -volume <value>	changes volume of audio. In range [0.0 1.0]
	-loop <true/false>	 defines if audio will be looped
	-info	shows some information about current audio stream
	-play	 starts audiofile from current point
	-pause	stops audio at current moment
	-stop	stops audio stream (pause + move to the beginning)
	-why?	why the hell are you reading this?
	-set <value>	Sets playback (current) time to give value in seconds. So, "-set 66" will set playback to 6:6
	-move <value>	Moves playback (current) time by given value in seconds. So, "-move 66" will set playback to 2:12 (132 sec)

Starts given application file. Usually, it's .sh file, but: 
	"he can be anyone of us"
		-Spy

	<filename>	path to an app path
If you think intro "typing" animation is too long for you, this command is exactly for you! Type "skipintro true"

HELP: Sets foreground(text) color by given index
DETAILED_HELP:
Sets foreground(text) color by given index
	Color codes:
		0	WHITE
		1	RED
		2	GREEN
		3	YELLOW
		4	BLUE
		5	PURPLE
		6	CYAN
		7	GREY
		8	BRIGHT GREY
		9	BRIGHT RED
		10	BRIGHT GREEN
		11	BRIGHT YELLOW
		12	BRIGHT BLUE
		13	BRIGHT PURPLE
		14	BRIGHT CYAN
		15	WHITE
		16+	SECRET
